com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Notifier

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.Notifier

public class Notifier
extends CWScriptable

Notifier broadcasts event notifications from data objects to UI controllers.
There are some events fired by system, such as adding or removing order items, saving document, changing data object validation status, etc. Those events are captured by system controllers, for ex. OrderUserInterface, DocumentUserInterface.

The instance of the class is created one per user session, which means that notifications are sent to the current application controllers only.

Notifier has API functions available in scripts and can be used to communicate between any scriptable objects. The type of the notification subject and listeners can be any: document, order, data strcuture or UI controller.

To add a listener for the particular notification subject, use register method:

Notifier.register(subject, listener, methodName);
where
subject is a data object of notification,
listener is a scriptable object to receive notifications and
methodName is a scriptable (not java) method name of the listener that will be invoked to process the event. The method should have one parameter: "event" type of "com.conceptwave.system.Event".
For an example, see the "onModelEvent" method of the system DocumentUserInterface or TreeNode.

To send a notification, use "notify" method:

var event = Notifier.notify(subject, eventType, parameters);
where
subject is a data object of notification. In the listener's method the subject can be retrieved by event.source.
eventType is a String event type, ex "add", "delete", "update". Can be retrieved by event.type variable.
parameters accepts null, one object or an Array. One object is being converted into Array with one item. To get parameters in the listener's method, use event.param variable: can be null or an Array.

The "notify" method returns the created com.conceptwave.system.Event object. This object is also used for callback notifications: when the event listener populates parameters of the event object, so the sender can retrieve them.

You also can use "eventNotify" method to send your own com.conceptwave.system.Event object (must have event.source populated with the subject):

Notifier.eventNotify(event);

There are two ways to unsubscribe listeners:

Notifier.unregister(listener); // remove particular listener
Notifier.unregisterAll(subject); // remove all listeners of the data object

Method Detail

clear

public static void clear()
Remove/unregister all existing listeners

notify

public static Scriptable notify(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object dataObject,
                                String type,
                                com.conceptwave.scripting.Object params)
Sends event notification:

Parameters:
dataObject - A subject of notification
type - An event type, for ex "add", "delete", "update", etc. See CwfContext for system event types (DN_TYPES).
params - Event parameters: can be null, an object, Object[] or NativeArray Array.
Returns:
A created instance of com.conceptwave.system.Event controller: can be used for callback notifications.

register

public static void register(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object dataObject,
                            Scriptable listener,
                            String method)
Subscribes the listener object to receive event notifications from dataObject

Parameters:
dataObject - A subject of notification
listener - Receiver Scriptable object
method - A method name of the listener to invoke when receiving a notification

unregister

Unsubscribes the listener from receiving notifications from the dataObject

Parameters:
dataObject - A subject of notification
listener - A listener
